metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14954 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The waitid implementation in kernel/exit.c in the Linux kernel through4.13.4 accesses rusage data structures in unintended cases, which allowslocal users to obtain sensitive information, and bypass the KASLRprotection mechanism, via a crafted system call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required
